start.tip:
EXIF Printer is a small free and open source web tool aimed at amateurs and photography enthusiasts who want to share some technical information along with their images.
From camera model or focal length to authors and titles, usually this data is written inside your images.

EXIF Printer allows you to pretty-print it as an overlay.

loadImage.tip:
(1) Click this button to load an image from your hard drive.

All work is done within your browser and no data will be uploaded to the server.

Privacy guaranteed!

adjustOverlay.tip:
(2) Move and resize the overlay as needed.

To move it, just drag a finger on the image or the mouse while holding down the left button.

You can resize it by pinching with 2-fingers or simply rolling the middle mouse wheel over the image.

tagSelect.tip:
(3) Click and select the tags you want to display
(more tags coming in future updates!).

If an icon is red it means there is no such data in your image.

You'll see a brief description of the tag when you click on it.

changeStyle.tip:
(4) Choose a predefined style from the list or create your own.

Clicking on the color boxes will open a color picker!

adjustMetrics.tip:
(5) (Optional) Here you can edit the metrics.

Adjust line spacing, text and icon size
(more options coming in future updates!)

saveResult.tip:
(6) Click on this button to save your work to your hard drive.

Let me know if you liked EXIF printer, see you soon!
